movies.title: Love Under the Elms
movies.plot: During a vacation, a teenager couple falls in love. Then their single parents fall in love too.
movies.simplePlot: During a vacation, a teenager couple falls in love. Then their single parents fall in love too.

biography.bio: Befitting her original name (Violet Pretty), the knockout English brunette Anne Heywood won the coveted "Miss Great Britain" beauty title in 1950 at the young age of 17. Born on December 11, 1932, the daughter of a violinist, she originally trained at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. She gained early experience on the stage with the Highbury Players in Birmingham and moved on to some TV work. The Rank Organization caught sight of her and offered the former beauty queen a seven-year contract. During that time, however, she was pretty much relegated to playing 'nice girl' types in the 50s and 60s. In later career, her film appearances courted controversy and she seemed drawn toward highly troubled, flawed characters. Very popular with Italian audiences, Anne never endeared herself to American filmgoers although she did stir up some curiosity with one of her more noteworthy films, the pioneer lesbian drama Le renard (1967). Starring Anne with Sandy Dennis, the two were quite believable as an unhappy, isolated couple whose relationship is irreparably shattered by the appearance of a handsome stranger (Keir Dullea). At the height of the movie's publicity, Playboy magazine revealed a "pictorial essay" just prior to its 1967 release with Anne in a nude and auto-erotic spread. The film won a "Best Foreign Film" Golden Globe Award (it was made in Canada) and Anne herself earned a "Best Actress" nod. Despite being aggressively promoted in its aftermath by husband/producer Raymond Stross, who was instrumental in reshaping her image with such sexy, offbeat dramas as The Night Fighters (1960), The Very Edge (1963), Ninety Degrees in the Shade (1965), Midas Run (1969), I Want What I Want (1972) and Good Luck, Miss Wyckoff (1979), Anne has remained a distinct European film product. Following her husband's death in 1988, Anne remarried (to a former New York Assistant Attorney General) and begged away from the camera. The couple settled in Beverly Hills.
biography.name: Anne Heywood

biography.bio: Claudio Cassinelli was born on September 29, 1938 in Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy. He was an actor, known for The Mountain of the Cannibal God (1978), Murder-Rock: Dancing Death (1984) and La lame infernale (1974). He died on July 12, 1985 in Page, Arizona, USA.
biography.name: Claudio Cassinelli

biography.bio: Mark attended stage school in London, England as a young child and made his film debut in The Counterfeit Constable (1964) at the age of six. He made countless TV appearances and became very well known in England. Worldwide fame developed as a result of his portrayal of a stuttering child in Our Mother's House (1967). Producers of Oliver! (1968) auditioned 250 child actors for the title role and finally chose him. Many roles for TV, film and stage followed. His last major film was Crossed Swords (1977). He now lives with his wife and two children in Cheltenham, England. He and his wife are osteopaths.
biography.name: Mark Lester

biography.bio: Monica Guerritore was born on January 5, 1958 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. She is an actress, known for La lupa (1996), Tell No One (2012) and The Worst Week of My Life (2011). She has been married to Roberto Zaccaria since August 17, 2010. She was previously married to Gabriele Lavia.
biography.name: Monica Guerritore

biography.bio: Giovanna Di Bernardo is an actress, known for What Have You Done to Solange? (1972), Love Under the Elms (1975) and Pistol Packin' Preacher (1971).
biography.name: Giovanna Di Bernardo

biography.bio: Bruno Zanin was born on April 9, 1951 in Vigonovo, Veneto, Italy. He is an actor, known for Amarcord (1973), Il caso Moro (1986) and Inganni (1985).
biography.name: Bruno Zanin

biography.bio: Vincenzo Ferro is an actor, known for Love Under the Elms (1975), Comment faire cocu les maris jaloux (1972) and Plaisir charnel du nouveau decameron 300 (1972).
biography.name: Vincenzo Ferro

biography.bio: Janine Samona is an actress, known for Love Under the Elms (1975).
biography.name: Janine Samona

biography.bio: Anna Waidmann is an actress, known for Love Under the Elms (1975).
biography.name: Anna Waidmann

biography.bio: Giuseppe Winkler is an actor, known for Love Under the Elms (1975).
biography.name: Giuseppe Winkler

biography.bio: Lorenzo Piani was born on January 19, 1944 in Monfalcone, Gorizia, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy. He is an actor, known for Scent of a Woman (1974), Deep Red (1975) and Vers un destin insolite, sur les flots bleus de l'été (1974).
biography.name: Lorenzo Piani
